text.content:
JOB#: 2953525

PATIENT NAME:  AVIVAPATIENT,SIX

DATE OF ADMISSION:  2/15/2013
DATE OF DISCHARGE:  2/28/2013

REASON FOR ADMISSION:  Suicidal ideation.

DSM DIAGNOSES:
Axis I:  Major depressive disorder, recurrent
Axis II:  Deferred.
Axis III:  Hypertension, anemia, hyperlipidemia, hypothyroidism.
Axis IV:  Limited social support, teenage kids, chronic mental illness, 
history of trauma.
Axis V:  Global Assessment of Functioning of 31 at admission, Global 
Assessment of Functioning at discharge 55.

PROCEDURE/OP PERFORMED:  Medication management.

CONSULTS:  None.

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:  Ms. Avivapatient is a 56-year-old African-
American female with a history of major depressive disorder presenting 
after increasing depressive symptoms and pervasive thoughts of suicide. 
The patient states that she no longer enjoys her work and does not have 
much in her life that makes her happy. 

PAST MEDICAL HISTORY:
Computerized Problem List is the source for the following: 
 
1. Obesity, Onset 00/00/04                            05/30/12  AVIVAUSER,THIRT
2. Hyperlipidemia                                     09/22/09  PROVIDER,ONE 
3. Diabetes Mellitus Type II or unspecified, Onset    05/10/12  PROVIDER,ONE 
00/00/05 
     Adequate control on oral medications.
     Goal to lose 50 pounds in 1 year.
4. Osteopenia, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
5. Postsurgical hypothyroidism, Onset 00/00/02        05/10/12  PROVIDER,ONE 
     Complete thryoidectomy for thyroid cancer in 2002.
6. Depression, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
7. Hypertension, Onset 00/00/05                       11/09/08  PROVIDER,ONE 



PAST PSYCHIATRIC HISTORY: 
--Outpatient psychiatrist: Dr. AvivaUser. 
  Outpatient social worker: Ms. AvivaUser. 
--Inpatient: 1st hospitalization for psychiatric illness
--Substance abuse: quit smoking approx 2002, rare alcohol use. 

PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: 
General Appearance: WD/WN, NAD
Skin Exam: Anicteric, no rashes, no bruises. 
HEENT Exam: Normocephalic; EOMI; sclera anicteric; conjunctivae normal.  PERRL 
Ears, nose and throat exam with normal limits.  Oral exam within normal limits. 
Neck Exam: The neck is supple, no adenopathy or thyroid enlargement noted;
trachea in midline. 
Cardiac Exam: The cardiac exam was within normal limits; no gallops, murmurs or 
rubs. 
Chest / Lung Exam: The chest is clear to auscultation. 
Abdomen Exam: The abdomen was obese, soft, bowel sounds normal, no 
hepatosplenomegaly noted. There was no guarding, tenderness, rebound, rigidity, 
masses. 
Extremity/Musculoskeletal: No clubbing cyanosis or pedal edema. 
Neurologic Exam: CNII-XII intact. Strength 5/5 throughout. Normal tone & Bulk. 
Sensation intact to fine touch. Reflexes 1+ & Symmetric throughout.  Normal 
gait. 


MENTAL STATUS EXAMINATION: 
Appearance: Casually dressed in purple sweatsuit. Appropriately groomed.
Cooperation/Eye Contact: Cooperative with appropriate eye contact.
Motor: No EPS, movement abnormalities, or psychomotor agitation/retardation.
Speech: Normal in rate, volume, and rhythm.
Mood: "good" 
Affect: Full range, appropriate
Safety: Denies any current SI/HI
Hallucinations: Denies any current auditory or visual hallucinations
Thought content: Free from paranoia, delusions, or other thought disturbances
Thought process: Linear, logical.
Associations: Intact
Language: Normal vocabulary and usage of words
Fund of Knowledge: Average
Insight: good
Judgment: good

LABS:
 HCT:      42.8     (02/27/13 09:16)
 HGB:      14.2     (02/27/13 09:16)
 MCH:      31.5     (02/27/13 09:16)
 MCHC:     34.8     (02/27/13 09:16)
 MCV:      83.3     (02/27/13 09:16)
 MPV:      8.4      (02/27/13 09:16)
 PLT:      173      (02/27/13 09:16)
 RBC:      4.42     (02/27/13 09:16)
 RDW:      12.2     (02/27/13 09:16)
 WBC:      7.5      (02/27/13 09:16)

 BUN:      12       (02/27/13 09:13)
 CL:       107      (02/27/13 09:13)
 CO2:      23       (02/27/13 09:13)
 CREAT:    1.1      (02/27/13 09:13)
 GLUCOSE:  119      (02/27/13 09:13)
 K:        4.1      (02/27/13 09:13)
 NA:       143      (02/27/13 09:13)


HOSPITAL COURSE: 
1.  Safety:  Patient was acutely suicidal on arrival and had 1:1 staffing for 
many days.  Patient denied any thoughts of hurting herself at time of discharge. 
The patient spent a great deal of time on her safety plan, identifying her 
warning signs as well as committing to increased social contact. 
Factors improving safety:  Patient is resourceful, history of response to 
treatment, religion. 
Factors impeding safety:  History of SI, chronic mental illness.

2.  Legal:  Patient signed in voluntarily at the beginning of her 
admission and stayed voluntary throughout her stay.  No other pending 
legal issues known.

3.  Psychiatric:  Stable on current medication regimine.  She slept well during 
the last few days of her stay in the hospital, and her mood greatly improved 
during her stay.  She was future-oriented at discharge and felt happy about her 
improvement.

4.  Medical: 
A.  Hyperlipidemia:  Continue Simvastatin.
B.  Hypothyroidism:  Continue Levothyroxine.
C.  Hypertension:  Continue Lisiniporil, Chlorthalidone
D.  Diabetes: Continue Glyburide
E.  Depressiom: Continue Effexor
F.  Osteoporosis:  Continue Ergocalciferol.


DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS:

ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB                  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG)  Sig: TAKE 500 MG BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY

CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB              Sig: TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP         Sig: TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB                  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125M  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB                  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB                 Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY EVENING

VENLAFAXINE HCL 37.5MG TAB           Sig: TAKE TWO TABLETS BY MOUTH TWICE A DAY

 


DISPOSITION/FOLLOW-UP CARE: 
Patient will follow up with PCP regarding DM, Hypertension.
Patient will follo wup with Mental Health Clinic for depression.



DATE DICTATED: 2/28/13@12:06
GGS/DATE TRANSCRIBED: 18677879/2/29/2013 11:42:55
VA JobID/2953525
GGSJobID/Rev: 2953525/0


$END
text.author: ATTENDING,MEDICINE TWO
